title: Can reading story books improve vocabulary? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi. Reading does improve vocabulary. If your are a beginner, you can start reading some short stories and proses. As you gradually increase your interest in reading, you can try reading books of different categories such as fiction, non fiction, biographies, tech etc. In my opinion, as you come across a new word, try understanding the meaning of the word through the sentence context. Mark the word with a pen or a pencil if you like. Then you can easily look up the word in a dictionary. I generally use a dictionary app to find meanings of words which I don't know. You can also read newspapers and magazines to improve your reading habits and vocabulary. Hope it helps :)

Undoubtedly yes, Reading story books is an excellent method to enhance your language skills. You not only improve your vocabulary but also increase your ability to comprehend the language. Only piece of advice to you is that, read extensively from topics varied interests and Do not try to mug up vocabulary. When you encounter any high sounding word, have a rendevouz with it ,spend some time with it, in a nutshell get familiar with it.
